posts.post_content:
I know this card is not in the best of shape, and I never had it graded. Could a few people here estimate its valve?
Tx.

[IMG]http://i1190.photobucket.com/albums/z460/John_Brennan/BaseballCards023.jpg[/IMG]
[IMG]http://i1190.photobucket.com/albums/z460/John_Brennan/BaseballCards021.jpg[/IMG]
I think $300 is too high given the condition. Just my opinion.
$225 would be my max. Check VCP for similar examples.

I'm a buyer for a Cobb bat off in this condition or slightly better for around the estimated values. It and the Johnson portrait are the 2 T206s that I really want. I know I can't afford great conditioned examples though.  If anyone else has something similar, I'd love a pm :D

[quote name="T206Collector" post=974553]About $300[/QUOTE]

at least $300 all day everyday on ebay

Agreed with Chaddurbin and others; in fact, I'd say it goes for more.

I'd offer $300 for it, but it seems woundedduck already has.
I'd also second his appeal to anyone else having another to trade/sell.

Doug

[quote name="chaddurbin" post=974590]at least $300 all day everyday on ebay[/QUOTE]

Yep!!
I'd say 400, 450 on a good day. To go for 300, a Cobb would have to be torn in half. Heck, I see fake Cobbs go for 300.

[quote name="npa589" post=974605]I'd say 400, 450 on a good day. To go for 300, a Cobb would have to be torn in half. Heck, I see fake Cobbs go for 300.[/QUOTE]

Agreed. At least $400.

yes i think it will go for around $400.  the glue shouldn't matters it will grade a 1.  

maybe a fair offer for both parties would be $350 net so seller won't have to bother with the ebay bs and fees and the buyer would get a nice retail discount.

Tx for all for the help,
I will offer the card for $450 or BO
Rgs,
John
Interesting strategy...I'll have to try that one sometime!!!

[quote name="welles_is" post=975500]Tx for all for the help,
I will offer the card for $450 or BO
Rgs,
John[/QUOTE]

My offer still stands

I sold the card. 
Again, I want to thank you all for your help. As I told many of you here, I am NOT a dealer. Also, I am new to the internet in regards to payment, shipping, etc. I felt like a greenhorn trying to mount a horse "The internet" for his first ride.
Rgs,
John
